Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member allowed two youth to use his vape pen.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 05/02/2023 and had no
additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced face-to-face
visit to her school on 05/04/2023 with DHHS Worker 2. She stated
that she recalled issues with staff members openly having and
using vape pens during her placement at the facility. She stated
that she recalled seeing Staff 1 “hit his vape” frequently and that
everyone knew about it. She also stated that she heard from
Youth B that Staff 1 had let Youth B use the vape in his
possession on at least one occasion. Youth A stated that she
never used the vape herself. Youth A recalled that she knew that
Staff 1 used a vape pen while working with the youth because she
would ask him “What flavor is that? It smells good” and she
recalled him replying that it was a “tropical summer” flavor. Youth
A also described the branding and color of the vape pen that she
recalled seeing Staff 1 use. She stated that she was shown the
vape pen by Staff 1 one time when she was outside of her unit
near the dumpsters in the back of the property. Youth A stated
that she did not use the vape pen during this instance, only that
she saw Staff 1 “hitting” the vape pen and she told him that he
needed to be careful where he used it because of cameras that
pointed outside. Youth A stated Staff 1 replied back that those
specific cameras did not work. She also stated she heard that
Staff 1 and Staff 4 were driving her unit back from an outing at the
movie theater when Staff 1 was using the vape while driving.
Youth A stated she did not see this herself. Youth A stated she
never used the vape pen herself.
Youth B was interviewed during an unannounced face-to-face
visit at her new placement on 05/04/2023. Youth B stated she
witnessed Staff 1 using a vape pen on many occasions, and
described the branding and flavor that she recalled him using.
2

This matched the description provided by Youth A during a
separate interview. She stated that on one occasion she asked
Staff 1 “Is that a Breeze Pro?” and he replied “Shhh.” Youth B
stated she then asked Staff 1 “You going to let me hit it?” and he
proceeded to let her use the vape pen. Youth B stated this
occurred in the unit and that she believed no one else would have
seen it because it was around the corner toward the bathroom.
Youth B stated another youth placed told her that Staff 1 had let
her use the vape as well, but she could not recall which youth this
was. Youth B was interviewed again on 07/13/2023 over video
conference with DHHS Worker 1. She stated she used a vape pen
one time while in placement at the facility. She stated that she did
this in a bathroom in unit two. Youth B recalled there was no one
else in the bathroom. She could not remember who else was in
her unit other than Youth D. Youth B stated this instance occurred
when there were some staff playing cards in the unit. Youth B
stated she was able to get a vape pen from Staff 1 after he had
offered it to her when she witnessed him using it. Youth B could
not recall who the other staff was and believed they did not see or
hear them because they were not near each other. Youth B
recalled the brand and flavor of the vape pen that is consistent
with her past interview and interviews of other youth referring to
what they had witnessed Staff 1 use. Youth B stated she snuck
into the bathroom to take a few hits off the vape pen and then
gave the pen back to Staff 1 by putting it in between a few stacks
of paper on a table in order to hide it. Youth B recalled Staff 1
telling her “Don’t tell on me.” Youth B stated that she also saw
Youth D vaping one time, and Youth D stated to Youth B that she
got the vape pen from Staff 1. Youth B could not recall when or
where this occurred and did not believe she told anyone about this
information from Youth D.
Youth C was interviewed on 05/12/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
over a video conference. She stated she never used a vape pen
or saw Staff 1 using his vape pen while in the unit or on his duties.
She stated Youth B had told her that Staff 1 had let her use the
vape but could not recall any other details. She stated she saw
him using a vape pen, but it was normally while on break and out
in the parking lot near his car. Youth C also stated there was a
time when Staff 1 and Staff 4 took the unit to a movie and Youth C
witnessed Staff 1 using his vape pen outside the movie theater in
the parking lot while the youth were walking out from the movie.
Youth C believed Staff 4 was not using a vape pen during this
outing.
3

Youth D was interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 05/30/2023. Youth D stated she witnessed several
staff members use vape pens while on their duties at the facility
but could not identify all of them during the interview. Youth D
stated she knew that Youth B was able to use the vape pen from
Staff 1 because she saw Youth B do this in the bathroom of the
unit. She could not recall when this occurred. Youth D stated she
couldn’t tell what staff was around at the time and she did not
think that anyone else saw this occurrence. Youth D also stated
there was a time when she was outside with Youth B and Youth B
allowed Youth D to use the same vape pen, while a staff was
looking at their phone and not paying attention to them. Youth D
cannot recall who that staff was. She was not sure where Youth B
had gotten that vape pen from but she had been told by Youth B
previously that Youth B was able to use the vape pen that Staff 1
brought to work with him. Youth D was interviewed again on
06/07/2023 over video conference with DHHS Worker 1. She
stated that she could not really remember a month or a time for
the instance where she saw Youth B using a vape pen in the
bathroom of the unit. Youth D also made allegations that other
staff had either used vape pens while working and supervising the
youth, or let youth use the vape pens themselves. She stated Staff
6 was one staff in particular that she recalled. Youth D was with
Staff 6 in the supervisor office in the main building after they had
just come back from a visit to the hospital. Youth D stated she told
Staff 6 that she liked to vape a lot and Staff 6 said “You can try
mine” and then provided the vape pen to Youth D. Youth D stated
she used this vape pen three or four times during this instance.
Youth D stated this occurred just the one time and that she did not
tell anyone about it. Youth D also stated Staff 5 had let her use a
vape pen on another occasion. She stated she and Staff 5 were
alone in a car when Staff 5 was transporting Youth D to a doctor's
appointment. She stated she could not recall exactly when this
occurred, but it was after the instance with Staff 6. Youth D stated
she was talking about how she liked to vape and then Staff 5
stated that she had a vape in her purse. Youth D stated she saw
the vape, and Youth D grabbed it to use. She stated she used it
during this part of the ride and also one more time on the way
back from the appointment. Youth D stated she put it back in Staff
5’s purse. Youth D stated Staff 5 told her “Just don’t bring it up to
the other kids.” Youth D stated there was also a third staff that
would use their vape in the unit. She cannot remember who the
staff was, but that they were female. Youth D stated this staff was
sitting at the back door of the unit on the inside of the unit using
their vape, and Youth D approached her and asked if she could
use it. Youth D stated the staff let her use the vape pen. Youth D
4

believed that no one saw it because this was during an overnight
shift, and Youth D used it behind the small wall of her personal
aisle to hide it. Youth D recalled the staff stated, “not to say
anything.” Youth D stated she used this vape pen about six times
in quick succession, and then put it back on the table next to the
staff who grabbed it back. Youth D stated she could not remember
when this occurred, but that it was cold and rainy and at night.
Youth D recalled there were two other times this unnamed staff let
her use a vape. Youth D stated she was in the break room for staff
in the main building with the staff, and it was just the two of them.
Youth D recalled grabbing the vape pen from the staff’s purse
because she saw it out in the open. Youth D stated the other time
that she used the staff’s vape pen was when she was in the same
area along with the staff and Youth D grabbed it from the open
locker where the staff had some of her own personal items. Youth
D stated that she was going to hit it and the staff stated “okay”
back to her. Youth D then put the vape pen back in the locker.
Youth D stated she believed there might have been one other time
she used the staff's vape pen, but she could not recall when or
where. She repeated she could not remember who the staff was
or what their name was.
Youth E was interviewed on 05/31/2023 over the phone with
DHHS Worker 1. She stated she was in a unit with Youth B, but
she never saw Youth B use a vape pen. Youth E stated she knew
that there were more than one staff who worked in her unit who
used vape pens. She stated she knew this because the staff
attempted to hide the vape pens in their sleeves and would use
them while inside the unit supervising. Youth E stated there was
one male staff who she could not identify that she saw use a vape
pen on multiple occasions while inside the unit with the youth.
Youth E stated this male staff was driving the youth back from an
outing where they went to a movie, and she witnessed him using
this vape pen while driving three separate times. She recalled him
saying “Don’t say anything, you won’t get in trouble.” Youth E
stated the staff did not offer the vape pen to her. She repeated
she saw him tuck the pen in his sleeve, and then stuck his head
outside the window to blow out the smoke. She stated she could
not recall the day that this occurred, but it was cold and snowy
outside. Youth E stated she never talked to any peers or staff
about what she saw.
Youth F was interviewed over video conference on 06/02/2023
with DHHS Worker 1. She stated she witnessed Staff 1 using a
vape pen right outside the unit on one occasion during her time
placed at the facility. She stated he would drop it on occasion, and
5

she told him to “Pick it up before one of us pick it up.” Youth F
stated one time this occurred when the vape pen dropped out of
the front pocket of his backpack and another time it occurred
when it bounced on the floor underneath the staff table near the
front entrance to the unit. Youth F also stated she witnessed Staff
1 using this vape pen when he would poke his head outside the
door of the unit to do so. She said she never heard of staff letting
youth use vapes.
Staff 5 was interviewed over video conference with DHHS Worker
1 on 06/21/2023. Staff 5 recalled taking Youth D to several
doctor’s appointments and believed there were times she provided
the transportation without another staff present. Staff 5 denied
ever supplying or allowing a youth placed at the facility to use a
vape pen. Staff 5 stated she does not use vape pens in her
personal life and would not have had one on her person while
driving with any youth. Staff 5 also stated she was not aware of
any concerns of youth having access to vape pens and using
them while in placement other than one youth that might have had
access to a vape pen after coming back from a home visit in the
past.
Youth G was interviewed on 07/11/2023 over the phone with
DHHS Worker 1. She stated she had never heard of any youth
having vape pens while placed in a program, nor has she heard of
or saw staff using vape pens.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 07/13/2023 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated she had worked with Staff 1 several times
and had good experiences with him. She believed he had told her
once that he did not smoke or use vapes, and she stated she
never saw him use one. Staff 4 recalled going to the movies with
the youth and Staff 1 on a date in February. She stated she did
not think he used a vape, but she was in the very back of the van
and he was driving. Staff 4 also stated she did not see Staff 1 use
a vape pen while in the parking lot.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
07/13/2023. Staff 1 denied he ever let any youth using a vape
pen. He stated he used vape pens personally and described the
brand and flavor consistent with multiple youth interviews in this
investigation. Staff 1 stated any vapes that were on his person
when he came to work stayed in his car. He denied ever using
any while working with the youth. Staff 1 recalled he did have a
backpack that he carried drinks and other personal items in, but
he did not believe he ever carried vapes in that nor did they ever
6

fall out of it in front of the view of any youth. Staff 1 was asked
how youth would have known that he used vape pens at all and
he stated that maybe youth knew what car he drove when they
saw him go out to it on breaks, where he would use a vape pen on
occasion, or leaving the facility.
Interview with Staff 6 was attempted but she is no longer
employed for the agency and could not make contact.
DHHS Worker 1 confirmed during a video conference meeting on
08/09/2023 that there would be no findings to their investigation.
Documents reviewed:
• Staff 5’s employee file was reviewed. This contained one
documentation of discipline dated 11/21/2022 for an error in
medication passing.
• Staff 6’s employee file was reviewed with no instances of
employee discipline recorded.
• Staff 1’s employee file was reviewed. This contained no
documentation of any discipline during his time employed
with the facility. Staff 1 was placed on administrative leave
on 03/07/2023 as a result of a report of him having and
using a vape pen on campus during working hours. Facility
confirmed that there were never any allegations made to
them of Staff 1 supplying a vape pen to youth placed. Staff
1’s employment was subsequently terminated as of
03/16/2023 when the facility stopped operating.
Analysis Through interviews with staff and youth and documentation
reviewed there is not sufficient evidence to show a violation of the
rule due to staff providing vape pens for youth to use while placed
at the facility.
Consultation provided:
Consultation was provided in the areas of staff having verbal and
physical boundaries with youth and staff not having items such as
vape pens on their person or in backpacks or lockers while on
their shift supervising youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
7

residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff members were using vape pens while working and
supervising youth.
Investigation Youth A, Youth B, Youth D, Youth E and Youth F were all
interviewed separately, and all gave similar recollections of seeing
Staff 1 and other unnamed staff use vape pens while supervising
youth, whether that was within the units or right outside of them.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 05/25/2023 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated she remembered the issue of Staff 1 using a
vape pen while on his work duties. She stated she had reported
this to her supervisor because she saw Staff 1 walking through the
parking lot and using a vape pen on an outing and heard from a
lot of youth, they had seen the same occurrence.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 05/25/2023. She confirmed Staff 3 had told her that she had
concerns about Staff 1 using a vape while on an outing with the
youth. Supervisor 1 stated she told administration this information
right away and Staff 1 was placed on administrative leave
immediately.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
07/13/2023. He stated he used vape pens personally and
described the brand and flavor consistent with multiple youth
interviews in this investigation. Staff 1 stated any vapes that were
on his person when he came to work stayed in his car. He denied
ever using any while working with the youth.
Complainant was another consultant as this information was
obtained during the course of another investigation. No further
information was provided.
Documents reviewed:
• Staff 1’s employee file was reviewed. This contained no
documentation of any discipline during his time employed
with the facility. Staff 1 was placed on administrative leave
on 03/07/2023 as a result of a report of him having and
using a vape pen on campus during working hours. Facility
confirmed that there were never any allegations made to
them of Staff 1 supplying a vape pen to youth placed. Staff
1’s employment was subsequently terminated as of
03/16/2023 when the facility stopped operating.
8

• Facility policy titled “Smoke and Nicotine Free Environment
policy” dated 08/17/2016 was reviewed. This states that
facility buildings and properties are smoke and nicotine free
environments. Additional facility policy was provided that
states that “smoking, e-cigarettes, and chewing tobacco are
all prohibited on all facility property and in facility vehicles.”
• A “Statement of Driver Responsibility” signed by Staff 1 on
12/08/2022 was provided that stated “smoking and the use
of any smoking products is prohibited on facility property
including facility vehicles.”
Analysis Through interviews with staff and youth and documentation
reviewed there was sufficient evidence found that staff were using
vape pens while on site and supervising youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
